We are celebrating the <nowiki>[[LucidReleaseSchedule|release of Ubuntu 10.04 (Lucid Lynx)]]</nowiki> scheduled for April, 2010.  Lucid is a Long Term Support (<nowiki>[[LTS]]</nowiki>) release.  Physical and virtual (IRC & other) events are scheduled.  Each release cycle a number of efforts happen around the release.  Globally, <nowiki>[[UbuntuDeveloperWeek]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[UbuntuGlobalJam]]</nowiki> events happen a month or two before and focus on contributing to the release.  Parties (listed below) and <nowiki>[[UbuntuOpenWeek]]</nowiki> happen near or after the release.  If you are thinking about organzing one, <nowiki>[[BuildingCommunity-RunningReleaseParty]]</nowiki> has some hints and a video <nowiki>[[http://www.ustream.tv/recorded/6181333|how to do a release party.]]</nowiki> "... can be organized in literally 10 minutes."

=== Lucid Release Parties ===

We have planned Lucid release parties at IRC meetings on <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Meetings-10April04|April 4th]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Meetings-10April18|April 18th]]</nowiki> and on the mailing list.

These events are listed chronologically. World wide events have <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/global/16/detail/|their own list]]</nowiki>.

=== General Info ===
<nowiki>[[File:10-04_00.png|Ubuntu 10.04 LTS Lucid Lynx is here!|align="right"]]</nowiki>
* Ubuntu <nowiki>[[LucidLynx|10.04 LTS Lucid Lynx]]</nowiki> was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2010-April/000133.html|announced]]</nowiki> as Ubuntu's stable release April 29th, 2010. <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/1004|Release notes]]</nowiki> contain important information and should be read before should be read before <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LucidUpgrades|upgrading]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation|installing]]</nowiki>.
* The Canonical press releases for the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-10.04-desktop-edition|desktop]]</nowiki> & <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-10.04-server-edition|server]]</nowiki> versions have helpful 10.04 LTS overviews.  For higher level descriptions, the Canonical <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/products/whatisubuntu/1004features|Tour of new features]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/1004overview|technical overview]]</nowiki> might be interesting.
* When '''<nowiki>[[http://releases.ubuntu.com/10.04/|downloading 10.04 LTS]]</nowiki>''', please use the ''<nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BitTorrent|*.torrent]]</nowiki>'' files and <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/downloadmirrors|mirrors]]</nowiki> whenever possible.  Using these usually increases your download speed.
* For general Ubuntu information please see <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com|www.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki>  If you encounter a technical problem please first try using your favorite search engine to find a solution or begin in one of Ubuntu's many <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/communitysupport|community support areas]]</nowiki>.
* The <nowiki>[[UDS-L|Ubuntu Developer Summit]]</nowiki> for Lucid Lynx 10.04 was held Monday, 16 Nov - Friday 20 Nov 2009, in Dallas, TX.  A <nowiki>[[LucidLynx-TechnicalOverview|Technical Overview]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/lucid|Blueprints]]</nowiki> were used as guides for producing this release.
